message.access-to-collaborate: Allow open access for anyone to join the team, view data, and collaborate
message.active-users: Display the number of active users.
message.add-kpi-message: Identify the Key Performance Indicators (KPI) that best reflect the health of your data assets. Review your data assets based on Description, Ownership, and Tier. Define your target metrics in absolute or percentage to track your progress. Finally, set a start and end date to achieve your data goals.
message.add-policy-message: Policies are assigned to teams. In openMetadata, a policy is a collection of rules, which define access based on certain conditions. We support rich SpEL (Spring Expression Language) based conditions. All the operations supported by an entity are published. Use these fine grained operations to define the conditional rules for each policy. Create well-defined policies based on conditional rules to build rich access control roles.
message.add-role-message: Roles are assigned to Users. In OpenMetadata, Roles are a collection of Policies. Each Role must have at least one policy attached to it. A Role supports multiple policies with a one to many relationship. Ensure that the necessary policies are created before creating a new role. Build rich access control roles with well-defined policies based on conditional rules.
message.admin-only-action: Only admin can perform this action.
message.advanced-search-message: Discover the right data assets using the syntax editor with and/or conditions.
message.alerts-description: Stay current with timely alerts using webhooks.
message.alerts-destination-description: Send notifications to Slack, MS Teams, Email, or and use Webhooks.
message.alerts-filter-description: Specify the change events to narrow the scope of your alerts.
message.alerts-trigger-description: Trigger for all data assets or a specific entity.
message.all-charts-are-mapped: All charts are mapped with existing KPIs.
message.announcement-action-description: Set up banners to inform your team of upcoming maintenance, updates & deletions.
message.announcement-invalid-start-time: Announcement start time must be earlier than the end time
message.are-you-sure-delete-property: Are you sure you want to delete the property {{propertyName}}
message.are-you-sure-delete-tag: Are you sure you want to delete the {{type}} "{{tagName}}"?
message.are-you-sure-to-revoke-access: Are you sure you want to revoke access for JWT token?
message.are-you-sure-want-to-text: Are you sure you want to {{text}}
message.are-you-want-to-restore: Are you sure you want to restore
message.assess-data-reliability-with-data-profil: Assess data reliability with data profiler, lineage, sample data, and more
message.configure-webhook-message: OpenMetadata can be configured to automatically send out event notifications to registered webhooks. Enter the webhook name, and an Endpoint URL to receive the HTTP call back on. Use Event Filters to only receive notifications based on events of interest, like when an entity is created, updated, or deleted; and for the entities your application is interested in. Add a description to help people understand the purpose of the webhook and to keep  track of the use case. Use advanced configuration to set up a shared secret key to verify the webhook events using HMAC signature.
message.configure-webhook-name-message: OpenMetadata can be configured to automatically send out event notifications to registered {{webhookType}} webhooks through OpenMetadata. Enter the {{webhookType}} webhook name, and an Endpoint URL to receive the HTTP call back on. Use Event Filters to only receive notifications for the required entities. Filter events based on when an entity is created, updated, or deleted. Add a description to note the use case of the webhook. You can use advanced configuration to set up a shared secret key to verify the {{webhookType}} webhook events using HMAC signature.
message.confirm-delete-message: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this message?
message.create-new-glossary-guide: A Glossary is a controlled vocabulary used to define the concepts and terminology in an organization. Glossaries can be specific to a certain domain (for e.g., Business Glossary, Technical Glossary). In the glossary, the standard terms and concepts can be defined along with the synonyms, and related terms. Control can be established over how and who can add the terms in the glossary.
message.create-or-update-email-account-for-bot: Changing account email will update or create a new bot user
message.data-insight-page-views: Displays the number of times a dataset type was viewed.
message.data-insight-subtitle: Get a single pane view of the health of all your data assets over time.
message.dbt-run-result-http-path-message: dbt run results http path to extract the test results information.
message.deeply-understand-table-relations-messag: Deeply understand table relations; thanks to column-level lineage.
message.delete-action-description: Deleting this {{entityType}} will permanently remove its metadata from OpenMetadata.
message.delete-entity-permanently: Once you delete this {{entityType}}, it will be removed permanently
message.delete-team-message: Any teams under "{{teamName}}" will be {{deleteType}} deleted as well.
message.delete-webhook-permanently: You want to delete webhook {{webhookName}} permanently? This action cannot be reverted.
message.discover-your-data-and-unlock-the-value-: Discover your data and unlock the value of data assets
message.enables-end-to-end-metadata-management: Enables end-to-end metadata management with data discovery, data duality, observability, and people collaboration
message.fetch-dbt-files: Available sources to fetch dbt catalog and manifest files.
message.field-ca-certs-description: Certificate path to be added in configuration. The path should be local in the Ingestion Container.
message.field-insight: Display the percentage of data assets with {{field}} by type.
message.field-region-name-description: Region name. Required when using AWS Credentials.
message.field-use-aws-credentials-description: Indicates whether to use aws credentials when connecting to OpenSearch in AWS.
message.field-use-ssl-description: Indicates whether to use SSL when connecting to ElasticSearch. By default, we will ignore SSL settings.
message.field-verify-certs-description: Indicates whether to verify certificates when using SSL connection to ElasticSearch. Ignored by default. Is set to true, make sure to send the certificates in the property `CA Certificates`.
message.filter-pattern-include-exclude-info: Explicitly {{activity}} {{filterPattern}} by adding a list of comma-separated regex.
message.filter-pattern-info: Choose to include or exclude {{filterPattern}} as part of the metadata ingestion.
message.fosters-collaboration-among-producers-an: Fosters collaboration among the producers and consumers of data

message.ingestion-bot-cant-be-deleted: You can not delete the ingestion bot.
message.instance-identifier: Name that identifies this configuration instance uniquely.
message.kill-ingestion-warning: Once you kill this Ingestion, all running and queued workflows will be stopped and marked as Failed.
message.kpi-subtitle: Identify the Key Performance Indicators (KPI) that best reflect the health of your data assets.
message.kpi-target-achieved-before-time: Awesome! You’ve reached your target well before time.
message.kpi-target-overdue: Never mind. It’s time to restructure your goals and progress faster.

Use #mention to tag a data asset.

message.profiler-timeout-seconds-message: Optional number setting the timeout in seconds for the profiler. If the timeout is reached the profiler will wait for any pending queries to terminated its execution.

message.team-no-asset: Your team does not have any assets
message.team-transfer-message: Click on Confirm if you’d like to move {{from}} team under {{to}} team.
message.token-security-description: Anyone who has your JWT Token will be able to send REST API requests to the OpenMetadata Server. Do not expose the JWT Token in your application code. Do not share it on GitHub or anywhere else online.
message.total-entity-insight: Display the latest number of data assets by type.
message.tour-step-activity-feed: <0>{{text}}</0> help you understand how the data is changing in your organization.
message.tour-step-click-on-link-to-view-more: Click on the <0>title of the asset</0> to view more details.
message.tour-step-discover-all-assets-at-one-pla: Discover all your data assets in a single place with <0>{{text}}</0>, a centralized metadata store. Collaborate with your team and get a holistic picture of the data in your organization.
message.tour-step-discover-data-assets-with-data: Discover assets with the <0>{{text}}</0>. Get to know the table usage stats, check for null values and duplicates, and understand the column data distributions.
message.tour-step-explore-summary-asset: From the <0>"{{text}}"</0> page, view a summary of each asset, including: title, description, owner, tier (importance), usage, and location.
message.tour-step-get-to-know-table-schema: Get to know the table <0>Schema</0>, including column names and data types as well as column descriptions and tags. You can even view metadata for complex types such as structs.
message.tour-step-look-at-sample-data: Take a look at the <0>{{text}}</0> to get a feel for what the table contains and how you might use it.
message.tour-step-search-for-matching-dataset: Search for matching data assets by "name", "description", "column name", and so on from the <0>{{text}}</0> box.
message.tour-step-trace-path-across-tables: With <0>{{text}}</0>, trace the path of data across tables, pipelines, & dashboards.
message.tour-step-type-search-term: In the search box, type <0>"{{text}}"</0>. Hit <0>{{enterText}}.</0>
message.view-deleted-teams: View all the Deleted Teams, which come under this Team.
message.webhook-listing-message: The webhook allows external services to be notified of the metadata change events happening in your organization through APIs. Register callback URLs with webhook integration to receive metadata event notifications. You can add, list, update, and delete webhooks.
message.webhook-type-listing-message: Provide timely updates to the producers and consumers of metadata via {{webhookType}} notifications. Use {{webhookType}} webhooks to send notifications regarding the metadata change events in your organization through APIs. You can add, list, update, and delete these webhooks.
message.would-like-to-start-adding-some: Would like to start adding some?
